{"query": "What are all AWS regions where SageMaker is available?", "context": [{"id": null, "metadata": {"source": "./data/sagemaker_documentation/examples-sagemaker.md", "_id": "51986f60-6bcb-41ba-819a-81a53970f66e", "_collection_name": "sagemaker_documentation_v2"}, "page_content": "Working with Amazon SageMaker

Amazon SageMaker is a fully managed service that provides every developer and data scientist with the ability to build, train, and deploy machine learning (ML) models. See the following resources for complete code examples with instructions.

Link to Github

Link to AWS Code Sample Catalog", "type": "Document"}, {"id": null, "metadata": {"source": "./data/sagemaker_documentation/sagemaker-rl-distributed.md", "_id": "9e5ab60e-5b82-43bd-a621-1e6c3f882cee", "_collection_name": "sagemaker_documentation_v2"}, "page_content": "Distributed Training with Amazon SageMaker RL", "type": "Document"}, {"id": null, "metadata": {"source": "./data/sagemaker_documentation/sagemaker-marketplace.md", "_id": "e954eadc-051a-42fb-94ca-57799e109de9", "_collection_name": "sagemaker_documentation_v2"}, "page_content": "Buy and Sell Amazon SageMaker Algorithms and Models in AWS Marketplace

Amazon SageMaker integrates with AWS Marketplace, enabling developers to charge other SageMaker users for the use of their algorithms and model packages. AWS Marketplace is a curated digital catalog that makes it easy for customers to find, buy, deploy, and manage third-party software and services that customers need to build solutions and run their businesses. AWS Marketplace includes thousands of software listings in popular categories, such as security, networking, storage, machine learning, business intelligence, database, and DevOps. It simplifies software licensing and procurement with flexible pricing options and multiple deployment methods.

For information, see AWS Marketplace Documentation.

Topics

SageMaker Algorithms

SageMaker Model Packages

Sell Amazon SageMaker Algorithms and Model Packages", "type": "Document"}, {"id": null, "metadata": {"source": "./data/sagemaker_documentation/integrating-sagemaker.md", "_id": "659b9fdc-f9d5-40d6-a6f1-a752e2b955a4", "_collection_name": "sagemaker_documentation_v2"}, "page_content": "How Amazon SageMaker uses AWS Secrets Manager

SageMaker is a fully managed machine learning service. With SageMaker, data scientists and developers can quickly and easily build and train machine learning models, and then directly deploy them into a production-ready hosted environment. It provides an integrated Jupyter authoring notebook instance for easy access to your data sources for exploration and analysis, so you don't have to manage servers.

You can associate Git repositories with your Jupyter notebook instances to save your notebooks in a source control environment that persists even if you stop or delete your notebook instance. You can manage your private repositories credentials using Secrets Manager. For more information, see Associate Git Repositories with Amazon SageMaker Notebook Instances in the Amazon SageMaker Developer Guide.", "type": "Document"}]}
attributes.mlflow.spanOutputs: {"result": "I'm sorry for any confusion, but the provided context does not include information about the specific AWS regions where Amazon SageMaker is available. To find this information, you can refer to the AWS Regional Service List page on the official AWS website. This page provides a list of all AWS services and the regions where they are available. Here is the link to the page: <https://aws.amazon.com/about-aws/global-infrastructure/regional-product-services/>. Once you're on this page, look for \"Amazon SageMaker\" in the table to find the regions where it's available."}

attributes.mlflow.spanInputs:
{"question": "What are all AWS regions where SageMaker is available?", "context": "Working with Amazon SageMaker

Amazon SageMaker is a fully managed service that provides every developer and data scientist with the ability to build, train, and deploy machine learning (ML) models. See the following resources for complete code examples with instructions.

Link to Github

Link to AWS Code Sample Catalog

Distributed Training with Amazon SageMaker RL

Buy and Sell Amazon SageMaker Algorithms and Models in AWS Marketplace

Amazon SageMaker integrates with AWS Marketplace, enabling developers to charge other SageMaker users for the use of their algorithms and model packages. AWS Marketplace is a curated digital catalog that makes it easy for customers to find, buy, deploy, and manage third-party software and services that customers need to build solutions and run their businesses. AWS Marketplace includes thousands of software listings in popular categories, such as security, networking, storage, machine learning, business intelligence, database, and DevOps. It simplifies software licensing and procurement with flexible pricing options and multiple deployment methods.

For information, see AWS Marketplace Documentation.

Topics

SageMaker Algorithms

SageMaker Model Packages

Sell Amazon SageMaker Algorithms and Model Packages

How Amazon SageMaker uses AWS Secrets Manager

SageMaker is a fully managed machine learning service. With SageMaker, data scientists and developers can quickly and easily build and train machine learning models, and then directly deploy them into a production-ready hosted environment. It provides an integrated Jupyter authoring notebook instance for easy access to your data sources for exploration and analysis, so you don't have to manage servers.

You can associate Git repositories with your Jupyter notebook instances to save your notebooks in a source control environment that persists even if you stop or delete your notebook instance. You can manage your private repositories credentials using Secrets Manager. For more information, see Associate Git Repositories with Amazon SageMaker Notebook Instances in the Amazon SageMaker Developer Guide."}
attributes.mlflow.spanOutputs: {"text": "I'm sorry for any confusion, but the provided context does not include information about the specific AWS regions where Amazon SageMaker is available. To find this information, you can refer to the AWS Regional Service List page on the official AWS website. This page provides a list of all AWS services and the regions where they are available. Here is the link to the page: <https://aws.amazon.com/about-aws/global-infrastructure/regional-product-services/>. Once you're on this page, look for \"Amazon SageMaker\" in the table to find the regions where it's available."}

[32;1m[1;3m
<s>[INST]
System: 
You are an AI assistant that helps users with answering queries about documentation. You have access to a large collection of documents 
from AWS documentation, particularly SageMaker and have to answer in details and explain clearly.

User: 
Please answer my question about AWS documentation only based on provided context.


-----------
This is the context:
Working with Amazon SageMaker

Amazon SageMaker is a fully managed service that provides every developer and data scientist with the ability to build, train, and deploy machine learning (ML) models. See the following resources for complete code examples with instructions.

Link to Github

Link to AWS Code Sample Catalog

Distributed Training with Amazon SageMaker RL

Buy and Sell Amazon SageMaker Algorithms and Models in AWS Marketplace

Amazon SageMaker integrates with AWS Marketplace, enabling developers to charge other SageMaker users for the use of their algorithms and model packages. AWS Marketplace is a curated digital catalog that makes it easy for customers to find, buy, deploy, and manage third-party software and services that customers need to build solutions and run their businesses. AWS Marketplace includes thousands of software listings in popular categories, such as security, networking, storage, machine learning, business intelligence, database, and DevOps. It simplifies software licensing and procurement with flexible pricing options and multiple deployment methods.

For information, see AWS Marketplace Documentation.

Topics

SageMaker Algorithms

SageMaker Model Packages

Sell Amazon SageMaker Algorithms and Model Packages

How Amazon SageMaker uses AWS Secrets Manager

SageMaker is a fully managed machine learning service. With SageMaker, data scientists and developers can quickly and easily build and train machine learning models, and then directly deploy them into a production-ready hosted environment. It provides an integrated Jupyter authoring notebook instance for easy access to your data sources for exploration and analysis, so you don't have to manage servers.

You can associate Git repositories with your Jupyter notebook instances to save your notebooks in a source control environment that persists even if you stop or delete your notebook instance. You can manage your private repositories credentials using Secrets Manager. For more information, see Associate Git Repositories with Amazon SageMaker Notebook Instances in the Amazon SageMaker Developer Guide.

-----------
This is the question:
What are all AWS regions where SageMaker is available?

[/INST]
